quest.name: Violators Will Be Shot
journal: Guildmaster Luciane desires that you train under Silvairre.
You have been instructed to train under Silvairre, one of the most experienced archers in the guild. Speak with the Elezen and learn what he requires of you.

Curt as ever, Silvairre declares that the ability to read and anticipate enemy movements is essential to the art of archery. He then orders you to seek out and destroy targets hidden in the East Shroud─a region rife with savage beasts. If you are to complete this task, you will need to observe the behavior of the local fauna, and identify opportunities to pass by unnoticed. Only then will you be close enough to take aim at your targets.
You have successfully destroyed all of the targets. Report back to Silvairre at the Archers' Guild.

Your feat does little to earn you Silvairre's acceptance. He next tasks you with slaying Nezul Cattlan the Violator, the leader of an Ixali scouting party. Journey to the North Shroud, slip past the scouts, and slay their leader.
You have succeeded in slaying Nezul Cattlan the Violator, prompting his scouts to flee Gridania in disarray. Report back to Silvairre at the Archers' Guild.
Though Silvairre is quick to attribute your success to luck, he grudgingly agrees to stop agitating for your expulsion from the guild. Inform Luciane that you have completed your lesson.

Luciane is well pleased with your showing against the Ixal, and observes that while Silvairre may refuse to acknowledge your skill, his actions send a different message. Having completed the lessons of your superiors, Luciane pronounces you an archer in your own right, and teaches you the Repelling Shot technique to commemorate the occasion. Thus encouraged, you resume your quest for greater mastery of the bow.

※The next archer quest will be available from Luciane upon reaching level 20.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. I trust you have been keeping your nose to the grindstone.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: As I mentioned when last we spoke, you will train under Silvairre's tutelage today.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Put aside your misgivings and avail yourself of his wealth of experience. Go now, present yourself before him.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Hmph. I see it was too much to hope that you would not return.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: The others believe that you have potential, but I am not so easily convinced. Like so many adventurers, you have not the faintest inkling of what it means to be an archer.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: And how could you? Archery is the proud tradition of the Wildwood Elezen. The essence of this art─to read one's enemy─has been instilled in us over centuries. In that time, we have defended this great nation against every imaginable foe, granting us insight which you will never possess.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Can you recognize the subtle signs that betray a coming action? No. Can you accurately predict an opponent's movement? No. Can you glean your foe's intentions at a glance? No. And can such things be learned by one who knows nothing of our traditions? No.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: It is only out of respect for Luciane that I have agreed to teach you.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Go to the East Shroud and seek out the targets hidden there. But do not presume this will be as easy as before.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: As I told you, the ability to read one's enemies is fundamental to archery. Yet the trials set by my colleagues did not require you to do this.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Mine will. The targets you seek have been hidden─and I do mean hidden─in the midst of a region rife with savage beasts. They will play the part of your enemies.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: In the unlikely event that you spy a target, your limited range will necessitate that you slip past its bestial guardians prior to taking aim─a feat I consider beyond you. Hm? Was that a frown? Mayhap you are thinking that the Miqo'te set you a similar task? You are wrong. She asked merely that you consider where your foes are─I demand that you discern precisely where they will be. How, then, will you go about this?

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Observe them closely and discern their characteristics. Learn to read their movements and recognize patterns in their behavior.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: If it has eyes, let it not see you. If it has ears, let it not hear you. Be neither where it is nor where it means to be, and thereby pass unnoticed.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: But enough talk. Whether or not you heed my counsel is your decision. I will shed no tears should you fail.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: So you have returned. A passable performance for an adventurer, but the bare minimum for any archer.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: I carry with me generations of Wildwood tradition─a tradition built upon the bones of the many outsiders who tried to take what is ours.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: It was my ancestors who first learned to conceal their presence and fight from the shadows, to hold the enemy at distance to protect the weak. All of it, everything was─

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: This is a waste of time. You cannot understand.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: But if you are so intent upon following in the footsteps of my people...

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: I bid you go to the North Shroud. Ixali scouts have been sighted near the river west of E–Tatt's Spire, and─unless you are entirely ignorant of Gridanian history─I need not explain that this act of aggression is part of a centuries-old conflict.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: The minions do not matter. It is their leader, Nezul Cattlan the Violator, who must fall.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: He commands the scouts, and will be well guarded. Yet he stands upon hostile ground, with birdmen and not walls for protection. If you are diligent and determined, you can slip through their defenses and slay their leader.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: This is the art of the Gridanian archer. Embrace the wisdom I have bestowed upon you, and the fight will be short.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: ...If you see the deed done, adventurer, I will take it as proof of your commitment to us, and labor no more to drive you from the guild. Now go.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Even now, I struggle to credit the sentries' reports... Yet here you are, and Nezul Cattlan the Violator is no more. That a godsdamned adventurer should be so...

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text: Hmph. Only by the grace of Nymeia Herself could you have survived. But even though it was pure luck, I will keep my word. Forename─should you stay or should you go, I...care not.

dialogue.name: SILVAIRRE
dialogue.text:
You have completed the task and are no longer my responsibility. Go now to Luciane. She will doubtless wish to lavish you with praise.
...Hm? Oh, you'll get no more from me. Off with you!

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: I am given to understand that you single-handedly drove off an Ixali scouting party─and that you did so with precision and guile.

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: How exactly was that training, Luciane? Forename's just an adventurer. Silvairre thrust herhim into the jaws of the enemy in the hope that shehe wouldn't come back!

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: And when, against all expectation, shehe did come back, that stubborn arse still refused to acknowledge herhis skill!

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: ...Is that truly your impression?

dialogue.name: LEIHALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Well, yes! He said it was pure luck!

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Mere noise. Silvairre sees Forename's skill, of that I have no doubt. Did you not mark the way he covered his mouth when he uttered the words?

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: It is a habit of his to do so on those occasions when his tongue and his heart are in disagreement.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: For all his skill at reading the idiosyncrasies of others, he has yet to recognize his own.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Impressive work, Forename. You have applied yourself to Leih and Silvairre's lessons and demonstrated your command of the core concepts.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: You are now an archer in your own right. Allow me to teach you something to commemorate this accomplishment.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Repelling Shot is an advanced technique that enables an archer to evade attacks whilst continuing to fire upon herhis opponent. Used wisely, it can grant you a brief respite in the heat of battle.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: I have faith that, with regular practice, you will learn how best to employ it to your advantage. Remember your seniors' lessons as you strive for true mastery.

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text:
Duty calls. Do you wish to proceed with
“Training with Silvairre”?

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: IXAL01
dialogue.text: Squaaawk! What that!?

dialogue.name: MIRAUDONT
dialogue.text: Ixal!? In my forest!? Not if I have anything to say about it!

dialogue.name: MIRAUDONT
dialogue.text: I shall assist you, adventurer!

dialogue.name: MIRAUDONT
dialogue.text: Ware the leader's magicks! Maintain a safe distance!

dialogue.name: MIRAUDONT
dialogue.text: Ugh, is...is that all you...
